message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the earth's tilt and its relationship to the seasons. Summer is the season when a portion of the planet is in closer proximity to the sun. This is because of the tilt of the earth's axis, which causes one hemisphere to receive more direct sunlight and experience warmer temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because solar flares are not directly related to the seasons. Option (B) is incorrect because the rotation of the hemispheres does not determine the seasons. Option (D) is incorrect because the sun's activity does not change significantly based on the seasons.
